In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(strip(col))
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    str = replace(str, r"[-\\s]+" => "_")
    
    return str
end
```

This function takes a `String` as input (`col`) and returns a cleaned version of the string. It first lowercases the entire string using `lowercase()`, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces with `strip()`. Finally, it replaces all spaces and hyphens within the string with underscores using `replace()` and a regular expression.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```
